alert.note: Alert for Northern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 5:10PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Tehama County through 600 PM PST... At 509 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blossom, or 10 miles southwest of Red Bluff, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Tehama County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
